intro: Turpinia montana var. borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean turpinia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Borneo. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in lowland and montane forest areas, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers, which are usually white or pale pink, are clustered in umbels and attract various pollinators. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
